definition: to have no other choice
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to choose/to pick/to select/to elect
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]

sentences.english: He had no choice but to comply, allowing the Imperials aboard.
sentences.chinese: 他别无选择，只能照办，同意帝国检查队登舰。

sentences.english: In an emergency, buyers under duress have no freedom.
sentences.chinese: 在紧急关头，买家迫不得已别无选择。

sentences.english: "I'd never mobilized people before, but I had no choice, " says Alger.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从来没有动员过别人，但我别无选择。

sentences.english: The USGA gave me no option but to stand up and fight them, and fight them I did.
sentences.chinese: USGA让我别无选择，我只有站起来跟他们对抗。

sentences.english: You have no choice but to break away from the illegal organization.
sentences.chinese: 除了摆脱那个非法组织，你别无选择。

sentences.english: Wipe away tears, we have nothing to do but adamancy.
sentences.chinese: 擦干眼泪，除了坚强我们别无选择。

sentences.english: The choice was clear -- abandon them, or his dreams.
sentences.chinese: 似乎是别无选择了，抛弃他们，或者继续做白日梦。

sentences.english: I had no option but to agree.
sentences.chinese: 我除了同意以外别无选择。

sentences.english: Diesel oil looks not so good, but there is no choice.
sentences.chinese: 尽管柴油看起来并不怎么好，但也别无选择了。

sentences.english: They have little choice, but it may be a mission impossible.
sentences.chinese: 他们别无选择，但这或许只是个不可能完成的使命。

sentences.english: I was left with no choice but to fight my way out.
sentences.chinese: 我别无选择，只能背水一战。

sentences.english: We had no choice but to wait.
sentences.chinese: 除了等待，我们别无选择。

sentences.english: No choice to be the next retaining the power of a death Lucia.
sentences.chinese: 在别无选择的情况下一护得到露琪亚的力量成为死神。

sentences.english: Yang Zhiyuan besides nonofficeholding Ren Youya the tiger is bought outside have no alternative.
sentences.chinese: 杨致远除了下台任由雅虎被收购外别无选择。

sentences.english: 'We had no choice but to do further research, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，我们别无选择，只能深入调查。

sentences.english: He had no choice, and turned to see the LCD screen of display.
sentences.chinese: 别无选择，他回过头看着显示器的液晶屏幕。

definition: there is no alternative
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
as matters stand/things having reached this stage
(idiom) dead end/road to ruin
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
impotent (idiom)/powerless/helpless
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: lit. once you've shot the arrow, there's no getting it back (idiom)/fig. once you started sth, there's no turning back/to have to finish what one started/to be determined to reach one's goals in spite of setbacks
pinyin: kai1 gong1 mei2 you3 hui2 tou2 jian4

definition: to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
to stake all on one throw
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
